  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE ARRIVED AT THE HAZMAT CAGE WITH THE BOX OPEN AND THREE OF THE BOTTLES MISSING. THE BOX WAS RIPPED AT THE BOTTOM THE REMAINING BOTTLE OF CIDEHOL 70 (ISOPROPANOL) HAD LEAKAGE FROM A LOOSE CAP. THIS PACKAGE WILL BE SCRAPPED UNLESS OTHERWISE.

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-26
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ

  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE ARRIVED AT THE HAZMAT CAGE SHOWING OBVIOUS SIGNS OF INTERNAL LEAKAGE, UPON INSPECTION TWO BOTTLES OF RAPICIDE (PART B) WAS FOUND FULLY LEAKED OUT. ONE CAP WAS LOOSE AND ONE CAP MISSING. THE REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM TO BE SCRAPPED UNLESS OTHERWISE.

item.title: Report E-2024050588
item.description:
Report E-2024050588

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-07T18:15:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-21
  • City: Manville
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 2000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 5/21/24, at 1100 hours, FRA Inspector Vincent Au in the CSXT Manville Yard discovered DNAX 130040, Residue tank car UN1993 Flammable Liquid (Acetone, Toluene) with an improperly placed manway gasket, and a vapor release from the vacuum release device. The railcar was isolated in yard, and National Response Center and New Jersey Department of Environment were notified, report number 24-05-23-1554-22. The emergency contact number on the waybill was contacted: 877-818-0087, Velocity Emergency Call Service, with Shipper Contact listed as David Solecki from Veolia Inc. CSX Manager of Hazardous Materials Graham Clark made contact with David Solecki and informed him of situation. MEI, a CSX response contractor was dispatched to the scene, and found the improperly placed manway gasket and defective vacuum relief device. MEI corrected the gasket placement, and removed the vacuum relief device, and put a plug in DNAX 130040. The plug secured the release, and corrective actions were communicated to David Solecki and FRA Inspector Vincent Au. The tank car has remained held from transportation pending receipt of an OTMA or further repair by certified repair unit.
